sentence.Network_en: The decor is simple—black lacquer panels on white walls.
sentence.Network_cn: 装潢风格非常简单——白色墙上镶着漆成黑色的裙板。

sentence.Network_en: We put on the second coating of lacquer.
The red lacquer work on the upper wall was badly chipped.
sentence.Network_cn: 墙面上的红漆已经脱落了不少.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting lac): from obsolete French lacre 'sealing wax', from Portuguese laca (see lac)

entry.def: Lacquer is a special liquid which is painted on wood or metal in order to protect it and to make it shiny.

example.ex: We put on the second coating of lacquer...
Only the finest lacquers are used for finishes.
example.tran: 只有上等好漆才能用作罩面漆。

entry.def: Lacquer is a clear sticky liquid that you spray on your hair in order to hold it in place.

means.word_mean: 1. a black resinous substance obtained from certain trees and used as a natural varnish

auth_sentence.res_content: She became the perfect amalgam of lacquer, Lycra and lucre.

auth_sentence.content: Su Tong's morbid fantasia wears an opaque lacquer of willful elegance.
auth_sentence.res_content: Su Tong's morbid fantasia wears an opaque lacquer of willful elegance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Su Tong's morbid fantasia wears an opaque lacquer of willful elegance.

means.word_mean: 涂漆于， 给（木制品或金属）涂漆

sentences.en: It was the kind of house best displayed by lacquered floors and some wicker here, some velvet there.
sentences.cn: 这是那种只有配上清漆地板、柳编器具、天鹅绒才相得益彰的房子。
